scope.title: Scope
scope.description: Execute policy on request (HEAD) phase, response (HEAD) phase, request_content (includes payload) phase, response content (includes payload) phase.

invocationType.title: Invocation Type
invocationType.description:
RequestResponse (default) – Invoke the function synchronously. Keep the connection open until the function returns a response or times out. The API response includes the function response and additional data.
Event – Invoke the function asynchronously. Send events that fail multiple times to the function's dead-letter queue (if one is configured). The API response only includes a status code.
DryRun – Validate parameter values and verify that the user or role has permission to invoke the function.

qualifier.title: Qualifier
qualifier.description: Specify a version or alias to invoke a published version of the function.

logType.title: Log Type
logType.description: Set to Tail to include the execution log in the response. Applies to synchronously invoked functions only.

roleArn.title: Assume Role ARN
roleArn.description: The arn of the role to be assumed. This is used when authentication is relying on the AWS Security Token Service (STS) to assume a Role and create temporary, short-lived sessions to use for authentication.

roleSessionName.title: Role Session Name
roleSessionName.description: An identifier for the assumed role session (Only used when authentication is based on AWS Security Token Service (STS)

sendToConsumer.title: Send lambda function result to consumer
sendToConsumer.description: Check this option if you want to send the response of the lambda to the initial consumer without going to the final upstream (endpoints) selected by the gateway.
